perturbation.original_text: Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00 Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer: 20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.
perturbation.changed_text: Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00 Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer: 20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid within 30 days of the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon substantial completion of Milestone #1, as determined by the Developer. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies the payment schedule as tied to the start of the project and completion of specific milestones. The modified text changes the first payment to 'within 30 days of the start of the project', and the second to 'substantial completion...as determined by the Developer'. This introduces ambiguity around when the first two payments are due, as 'substantial completion' is subjective and 'within 30 days' gives a range.

perturbation.original_text: The application will tie into the dispensaries POS system and pull the inventory, product details, price, and quantity o The application will pull data from the POS system once every 1-2 hours
perturbation.changed_text: The application will attempt to tie into the dispensaries POS system and pull the inventory, product details, price, and quantity. The application may pull data from the POS system once every 1-2 hours, or as frequently as the system allows.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the application 'will tie into' the POS system and 'will pull' data at a defined frequency, implying a guaranteed connection and data retrieval. The modified text changes 'will tie into' to 'will attempt to tie into', making the connection optional. It also changes 'will pull' to 'may pull' and adds 'or as frequently as the system allows', giving a much wider range of possibilities and uncertainties of retreival.

perturbation.original_text: o Driver will scan the customers ID using the Trulioo API right before they handle the delivery to the customer. After this last ID check, the transaction will be completed.
perturbation.changed_text: o Driver will scan the customers ID using the Trulioo API when feasible before they handle the delivery to the customer. After this ID check, if successful, the transaction will be completed.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the driver 'will scan' the customer's ID, implying a mandatory step. The modified text inserts 'when feasible', making the ID scan conditional, and adds 'if successful', meaning that even if scanned it may not be considered completed. This makes it less specific whether a transaction is completed.
